de.engehausen.treemap
Interface ITreeMapLayout<N>

Type Parameters:
N - the type of node the layout supports.
All Known Implementing Classes:
BorderSquarifiedLayout, SquarifiedLayout
public interface ITreeMapLayout<N>

Tree map layout interface. The methods allow to create a layout of rectangles from a given weighted tree model.

Method Summary
 ITreeModel<IRectangle<N>> layout(IWeightedTreeModel<N> treeModel, N startingNode, int width, int height)
          Creates a layout of rectangles, starting at the current node for the given width and height.
 ITreeModel<IRectangle<N>> layout(IWeightedTreeModel<N> treeModel, N startingNode, int width, int height, ICancelable cancelable)
          Creates a layout of rectangles, starting at the current node for the given width and height.
 

Method Detail

layout

ITreeModel<IRectangle<N>> layout(IWeightedTreeModel<N> treeModel,
                                 N startingNode,
                                 int width,
                                 int height)
Creates a layout of rectangles, starting at the current node for the given width and height.

Parameters:
treeModel - the tree model to lay out
startingNode - the starting node in the tree model the layout operates on; must not be null.
width - the width to use for the layout.
height - the height to use for the layout.
Returns:
a tree model holding the rectangles representing the used nodes in hierarchical order, never null.

layout

ITreeModel<IRectangle<N>> layout(IWeightedTreeModel<N> treeModel,
                                 N startingNode,
                                 int width,
                                 int height,
                                 ICancelable cancelable)
Creates a layout of rectangles, starting at the current node for the given width and height.

Parameters:
treeModel - the tree model to lay out
startingNode - the starting node in the tree model the layout operates on; must not be null.
width - the width to use for the layout.
height - the height to use for the layout.
cancelable - an indicator that can cancel the layout operation if ICancelable.isCanceled() returns true. The argument must not be null. If the operation is canceled, the result may be incomplete.
Returns:
a tree model holding the rectangles representing the used nodes in hierarchical order, never null.
